form.location_example: For example: On the wall near the entrance

modal.available_in_osm: Available in OpenStreetMap with the url:
modal.should_appear_soon: Object should appear on the map within 60 minutes.
modal.title: Information
modal.need_to_login: To add features you need to log in using OpenStreetMap account.
modal.click_login_button: Close this window and click login button at the top to log in.
modal.need_more_zoom: To add features you need to zoom in so the location that you provide is accurate.
modal.zoom_need_to_be: Zoom needs to be at level 15 minimum.
modal.about_project: OpenAEDMap is an open-data project which shows all Automated External Defibrillators (AED) around the world. The website is based on data from OpenStreetMap and is the result of OpenStreetMap Poland's association efforts. It was created in 2022 after changing the Polish website AED Mapa to a new design.
modal.about_osm: OpenStreetMap (OSM) is like a Wikipedia for maps. It's available to use for everyone and anybody can add objects to the map. You can use your OSM account to add AED locations directly from this site using a simple form.
modal.create_account: You can contribute too! Just create a free account on
